DataElement.preferredName: Person Specimen External Investigator Consent Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether whether the patient agreed to use of specimens by outside researchers.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the consent or permission from a person to use a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid by external researchers and investigators.

Property.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:Happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits, or especially, some surface.:An individual who conducts scientific research. In a clinical setting this individual actually conducts or/and supervises the clinical investigation and study-related procedures; monitors the safety of the trial subjects and investigational staff (i.e., under whose immediate direction an agent is administered or dispensed to a subject), collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
Happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits, or especially, some surface.

An individual who conducts scientific research. In a clinical setting this individual actually conducts and/or supervises the clinical investigation and study-related procedures.  The investigator monitors the safety of the trial subjects and investigational staff (under whose immediate direction an agent is administered or dispensed to a subject).  The investigator collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Patient has given NCCTG permi
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given NCCTG permission to give their blood and paraffin-embedded tissue to outside researchers

ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given NCCTG permission to give tissue sample(s) to outside researchers

ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission for NCCTG/Alliance to give his/her sample(s) to outside researchers

ReferenceDocuments.description: Participant has given permission to send blood and/or tissue sample(s) to researchers at an outside institution

ReferenceDocuments.description: Participant has given permission to send blood sample(s) to researchers at an outside institution

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission for Alliance to give his/her stored urine samples for use in future research to outside researchers

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP Question Text - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Participant has given permission to researchers at an outside institution to have three additional blood draws done along with my protocol blood draws and that they may be used for future research to learn about, prevent, treat, or cure cancer and other health problems.

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Participant has given permission to send blood sample(s) and related information to researchers at outside institutions.

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP Question Text - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Participant has given permission to send sample(s) and related information to researchers at outside institutions.

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP Question Text - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Participant has given permission for specimens and related information to be sent to researchers at outside institutions.

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP Question Text - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Participant has given permission to send blood, urine, and/or tissue specimens and related information to researchers at outside institutions.
